q: to the haters: they show he's right.`` Doing anything remotely interesting will bring criticism,'' he says in a blogpost, The Benefits Of Pissing People Off, quoting href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/2246150.stm" title=""> Colin Powell . Pissing people off is both inevitable and necessary. The notion that having many detractors proves you're doing great, jealousy-inducing work is an article of faith among motivational authors.`` Being a success,'' says one blogger,`` means people hate

30 seconds where she is trying to get her eyes open and she finally opens her eyes, and you could tell she was desperately trying to focus, and it took enormous strength from her.'' Mark Kelson said,` If you can see me, give us the thumbs up.' Instead of giving us the thumbs up, she literally raises her whole arm.`` Then she starts reaching out and starts grabbing Mark Kelson , and like is touching him, and starts to nearly choke him. She is clearly trying to hug him. It was such a moment, and we were in such tears of joy watching this. Kirsten Gillibrand said that Gabrielle Giffords started to reach out and touch her husband's ring, his watch and his wrist. Later Piers Morgan wants to discuss Michael Vick , the dog-fighting NFL player, and Oprah Winfrey responds, I really don't want to talk about Michael Vick because I'm trying to interview him. Piers Morgan laughs and says he appreciates her honesty. They then bet 200 British pounds on who will get the first Michael Vick interview between them. as defence secretary by Robert Gates .`` The heart-breaking thing with respect to Guantanamo is not that there's anything wrong with it, it's one of the finest prison systems in the world,'' said Donald Rumsfeld . What's awkward is the fact that, for whatever reason, the administration was incapable of persuading people that that was a first-class operation, that they were not torturing people, that they were not hurting people, he said. The Sixers, who had a 13-game road winning streak snapped Tuesday in Toronto, moved 7 1/2 games ahead of the second-place Knicks in the Atlantic Division. This is the first real team I've been on in my life, Allen Iverson said.`` There are no egos, nobody cares who's shooting the ball, who has the name, who's the All-Star. Both groups have political-action committees that finance candidate campaigns and employ lobbyists in Sacramento, California's capital, the Treasurer's office said. Apparently, it's a practice all over the country, Bill Lockyer said today in a telephone interview.`` I don't think it's a good one.''-- With assistance from Michael B.
